title: American_Top_40_1973_May_12th
description:
"The biggest hits are yet to come as we count 'em down on our way to number one."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There an artist who found success doing remakes of old hits by other artists. He finally made it to number one with a song he wrote, but his current song is another remake.

Buchanan and Goodman had a hit in 1956, with a "flying-saucer" type record. One member of that team is back with another 45 that samples other hit songs.

There is the latest hit for a duo that have never missed the top 20, except for the time they remade a former Beatles number one and didn't even make the top 40.

There is a hit by an artist whose former band broke up three years ago and still has two top five albums on the LP chart.

A listener wants to know what number one song had the shortest title and which had the longest. Casey says the longest title had 41 letters, while the shortest only had 2.
